avalancheActivity.comment: The new snow and wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence especially on north to northeast to northwest facing aspects. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in north to northeast to northwest facing aspects and on wind-loaded slopes. Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack serve as an alarm indicating the danger. As a consequence of warming more frequent small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2000 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The soft wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence in particular on near-ridge shady slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack remains unfavourable in particular on steep shady slopes. Backcountry touring calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found in particular in the vicinity of peaks and on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2500 m. A clear night will be followed by favourable conditions, but the danger of wet avalanches will increase later. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2000 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs can be released in some cases in particular on very steep shady slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment: The older wind slabs are easy for the trained eye to recognise and can only be released in isolated cases.

avalancheActivity.comment: The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften during the day.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack will be well bonded at low altitude.

snowpackStructure.comment: The old snowpack is well consolidated and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust.
